intro: Cirsium stroblii, commonly known as the Strobli's thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in areas of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Cirsium stroblii is considered a rare and endangered species.
